events.1665: Raja Jai Singh treaty of Purandar was signed between the Mughals and Chattrapati Shivaji Maharaj.
events.1825: Dadabhai Naoroji, first Indian in British parliament and merchant, was born at Navsari, Gujarat. He coined the word 'Swaraj'.
events.1862: Kaminikumar Chanda, social reformer and politician, was born.
events.1880: Bhupendranath Dutt, Bengali litterateur and politician, was born.
events.1888: Mahatma Gandhi left for London, England to study Law.
events.1921: British govt. sends ultimatum to rebels in India, demanding their surrender within 48 hrs, at Madras.
events.1929: N. Hanumantha Rao, cricket test umpire for 9 tests from 1978-84, was born in Karnataka.
events.1952: India returns Peking's famine-relief aid, saying it had political strings attached.
events.1962: Kiran Shankar More, great Indian wicket-keeper in 49 Tests 1986-93, was born in Baroda.
events.1967: 6.5 earthquake at Koyna Dam in Maharashtra kills 200 people.
events.1979: India need 438 to win v England, game ends at 8-429.
events.1980: Second Commonwealth Regional Heads of Government Conference in New Delhi.
events.1983: INSAT-1B runs into snag, its solar array fails to deploy fully.
events.1984: Air Chief Marshal L. M. Katre, PVSM, AVSM and Bar, became the Air Officer Commanding, India Command. He was in this office till 01/07/1985.
events.1987: Roop Kanwar, an 18-year-old girl, commits Sati (burning herself in her husband's funeral pyre) in Deorala in Rajasthan.
events.1990: Congress (I) opposes the Prasar Bharati Bill in the Rajya Sabha saying the party wants the bill to be sent to a select committee.
events.1993: New Bank of India merged with Punjab National Bank.
events.1997: Dharmavir Bharti, great journalist and editor of Dharamyug, died at 6 am.
events.1998: Mumbai Metropolitan court acquits Union Minister for Environment and Forests Suresh Prabhu in a case of cheque bouncing.
events.1999: Umesh Chandra, Assistant Inspector General of Police, shot dead by the PWG in Hyderabad.
